SEARCH
Package io.brane.primitives.rlp

Class RlpString

java.lang.Object
io.brane.primitives.rlp.RlpString
All Implemented Interfaces:
RlpItem
public final class RlpString extends Object implements RlpItem
RLP representation of a byte string. Design notes: - Internally stores a byte[] "as is" (no mandatory copy) so that internal callers (decoder, numeric helpers) can avoid double copies. - Public factory methods (of(byte[]), of(String), of(long), of(BigInteger)) still perform defensive copies or build fresh arrays, preserving external immutability. - Encoded RLP bytes are cached lazily in encode() to avoid recomputing for hot paths that re-encode the same value many times (transactions, benchmarks, etc.).

  • Constructor Details

    • RlpString

      public RlpString(byte[] bytes)
      Constructs an RlpString wrapping the provided bytes without copying.

      This constructor is intended for internal use where the caller guarantees exclusive ownership of the array (e.g., decoder, numeric helpers).

      Parameters:
      bytes - the value to wrap (must not be null)

  • Method Details

    • of

      public static RlpString of(byte[] bytes)
      Creates an RlpString from the provided bytes, defensively copying them.
      Parameters:
      bytes - the bytes to wrap
      Returns:
      RlpString wrapping a copy of the provided bytes

    • of

      public static RlpString of(String hex)
      Creates an RlpString from a hex string with or without 0x prefix.
      Parameters:
      hex - the hex string to decode
      Returns:
      RlpString wrapping the decoded bytes

    • of

      public static RlpString of(long value)
      Creates an RlpString from a non-negative long value using minimal big-endian representation.
      Parameters:
      value - the value to encode
      Returns:
      RlpString wrapping the encoded value
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if value is negative

      value - the value to encode
      Returns:
      RlpString wrapping the encoded value
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if value is null or negative

    • bytes

      public byte[] bytes()
      Returns a defensive copy of the underlying bytes. This mirrors the former record component accessor and preserves immutability for API consumers.

    • encode

      public byte[] encode()
      Lazily encodes this RLP string. The encoded bytes are cached after the first call. This dramatically accelerates repeated encodings of the same RlpString, which is common in transaction building and benchmark loops. WARNING: - The returned byte[] MUST NOT be mutated by callers. - This cache is not strictly thread-safe, but benignly racy: at worst, multiple threads compute the same value concurrently.
      Specified by:
      encode in interface RlpItem
      Returns:
      encoded bytes

    • asLong

      public long asLong()
      Converts this RLP string to a long value. The bytes are interpreted as a big-endian unsigned integer.

      For values exceeding Long.MAX_VALUE, use asBigInteger() instead.

      Returns:
      the long value
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the value is too large for a long (> 8 bytes) or exceeds Long.MAX_VALUE

    • asBigInteger

      public BigInteger asBigInteger()
      Converts this RLP string to a BigInteger. The bytes are interpreted as a big-endian unsigned integer.
      Returns:
      the BigInteger value

    • asHexString

      public String asHexString()
      Returns the hex string representation of the underlying bytes. The result is prefixed with "0x".
      Returns:
      hex string with "0x" prefix
